page.title: 01Precis _ Guilsfield Without
page.content: Guilsfield Without is an area of farmland to the north of the village of Guilsfield in Mid-Wales.It is about ten miles from the English border,and approximately 18 miles west of Shrewsbury.The block surveyed is rather typical of the surrounding Welsh countryside.It is an area of undulating hills separated by mature river valleys. Guilsfield Without lies between the valleys of the Severn and the Vyrnwy.The highest point is 250m(a.s.l)and roughly 2/3rds is over 150m(a.s.l).There are 5 small streams, but no river of any size flows through the block.The land is exclusively used for farming ,with 30 farms of varying size within the region. The square 23,12 lies below the rest of the region in the valley. Stretching across the hill
